app module¶

app.add_crop_recommendation_to_field(field_data)[source]¶

Add crop recommendation to field data.

Call this function in your get_field route after getting weather data.

Parameters:

field_data – Dictionary with field information.

Returns:

Field data with ‘recommendation’ key added.

app.analyze_weather_patterns(weather_data)[source]¶

Analyze weather patterns from forecast data.

Parameters:

weather_data – List of daily weather forecasts with segments.

Returns:

Dictionary with average temperature, humidity, rain/hot/cold days, and total days.

app.app = <Flask 'app'>¶

Initialize Flask app

app.connected_users = {}¶

Store connected users (for production, use Redis or a database)

app.create_field()[source]¶

Create a new field for the logged-in user.

Expects JSON with ‘name’, ‘latitude’, ‘longitude’, and ‘crop_id’.

Returns:

JSON with created field data or error.

app.delete_field(field_id)[source]¶

Delete a field by ID for the logged-in user.

Parameters:

field_id – ID of the field to delete.

Returns:

JSON message indicating deletion status.

app.get_crop_recommendation(crop_id, weather_data)[source]¶

Get crop recommendation based on crop type and weather forecast

Args:

crop_id (str): “1” for Wheat, “2” for Carrot, “3” for Basil, “4” for Spinach weather_data (list): List of daily weather forecasts with segments

Returns:

dict: Recommendation with action and reasoning

app.get_field(field_id)[source]¶

Get a specific field by ID for the logged-in user, including weather forecast and crop recommendation.

Parameters:

field_id – ID of the field to retrieve.

Returns:

JSON with field data, weather, and recommendation.

app.get_fields()[source]¶

Get all fields for the logged-in user, enriched with weather data.

Returns:

JSON list of fields with weather info.

app.get_recommendation_logic(crop_id, crop_name, weather_analysis)[source]¶

Generate recommendation based on crop type and weather analysis.

Parameters:

  • crop_id – Crop ID as string.

  • crop_name – Name of the crop.

  • weather_analysis – Dictionary with weather analysis.

Returns:

Recommendation dictionary.

app.get_session()[source]¶

Get current session information.

Returns:

JSON with session status and user info.

app.handle_connect()[source]¶

Handle new SocketIO client connection. Starts a thread to send weather updates periodically.

app.handle_disconnect()[source]¶

Handle SocketIO client disconnection. Removes user from connected users.

app.index()[source]¶

Root endpoint to check if the Flask backend is running.

Returns:

JSON message indicating backend status.

app.login()[source]¶

Login endpoint for user authentication.

Expects JSON with ‘email’ and ‘password’. Loads users from JSON file and checks credentials. Sets session data on successful login.

Returns:

JSON with user info or error.

app.logout()[source]¶

Logout endpoint to clear user session.

Returns:

JSON message indicating logout status.

app.send_weather_periodically(sid)[source]¶

Periodically send weather updates to a connected SocketIO client.

Parameters:

sid – SocketIO session ID.

app.socketio = <flask_socketio.SocketIO object>¶

Initialize SocketIO with CORS support for the React frontend
